faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: Everything you need to know about Web of Trust

whatIsWot.question: What is Web of Trust?
whatIsWot.answer: Web of Trust measures social distance—how many 'hops' separate you from another user in the Nostr follow graph. If you follow someone, they're 1 hop away. If they follow someone else, that person is 2 hops from you. This helps filter spam and verify reputation without centralized blocklists.

howDoesItWork.question: How does it work?
howDoesItWork.answer: The WoT Extension indexes your follow list and calculates social distances to other users. Apps can then query this data through the window.nostr.wot API to filter content, prioritize notifications, or verify identity—all based on your personal social graph.

isItPrivate.question: Is my data private?
isItPrivate.answer: Yes. In Local mode, all calculations happen in your browser—nothing leaves your device. In Remote mode, only pubkey lookups are sent to the oracle (no content data). You can also self-host the oracle for complete control.

whichBrowsers.question: Which browsers are supported?
whichBrowsers.answer: The extension works on all Chromium-based browsers: Chrome, Brave, Edge, and Opera. Firefox support is planned for a future release.

isFree.question: Is it free?
isFree.answer: Yes, completely free and open source under the MIT license. The extension, SDK, Oracle API, and all source code are available on GitHub.

howToIntegrate.question: How do I integrate WoT into my app?
howToIntegrate.answer: You have three options: use the browser extension's window.nostr.wot API for client-side queries, use the nostr-wot-sdk npm package for a unified interface, or query the Oracle REST API directly for server-side integration.
